comments.body: Not really related to this pr - I was looking at the surrounding code and noticed that the `server_prop_overides arg` is defaulted to `[]`. Its probably fine since its not being written, but you almost never want that since every instance will share the same global list. Might want to fix that while you're here.
@rodesai what do you mean by the "global list"?

When the interpreter processes the function def it will initialize one list that it passes to every instance of KafkaService thats constructed without specifying its own server_prop_overrides. Here's an illustrative example:
```code
>>> class A(object):
...     def __init__(self, a, b=[]):
...         b.append(a)
...         self.b = b
...
>>> print A(1).b
[1]
>>> print A(2).b
[1, 2]
>>> print A(3).b
[1, 2, 3]
```
Got it, thanks! Please let me know if the fix makes sense to you.

Ah got it. I will try this in the code:

```
if server_prop_overides is None:
            self.server_prop_overides = []
else:
            self.server_prop_overides = server_prop_overides
```
